title: Democrats’ Scattered Response to Trump’s Iran Strikes Highlights Party Divides
summary: President Trump’s strikes on Iran have resurfaced old rifts among Democrats over war and peace that have been inflamed by a newer schism inside the party, over support for Israel.

title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Khamenei Makes First Public Comments in Almost a Week
summary: Supreme leader strikes defiant tone in a video statement, after not being heard of or seen publicly in days.

title: How Trump’s Strike on Iran Might Affect China’s Calculus on Taiwan
summary: By attacking Iran, President Trump has shown he is willing to engage in a distant war. This raises questions in Beijing about what he might risk for Taiwan.

title: Officials Share New Analysis of Iran Strike, and Zohran Mamdani Talks Next Steps
summary: Plus, Jeff Bezos’ contentious wedding in Venice.

title: Young Muslim Voters in NYC Loved Zohran Mamdani. Their Parents Listened.
summary: Many Muslim Americans in New York City were impressed by Mr. Mamdani’s campaign and thrilled at being able to see themselves reflected in a mayoral candidate.

title: Can Mamdani’s Energetic Campaign Be a Blueprint for Democrats?
summary: The progressive state lawmaker’s sleek social media presence and army of eager volunteers could offer his party a road map for how to win back voters.

title: Mamdani Triumphed Without a Majority of Black Voters. Where Does That Leave Them?
summary: Black city leaders are worried their influence is waning at a moment when the rising costs that Zohran Mamdani put at the center of his campaign are pushing Black New Yorkers out of the city.

title: Mamdani’s Success Spotlights a Deepening Rupture Among U.S. Jews
summary: While Zohran Mamdani won over some Jewish supporters, other Jewish Democrats suggested that concerns about their community’s safety are being dismissed in a movement and a city they helped build.

title: How America Changed After the Supreme Court Legalized Same-Sex Marriage in Obergefell v. Hodges
summary: On the 10th anniversary of the Supreme Court decision legalizing same-sex marriage nationally, supporters say they are secure but also wary and watchful.

title: Before Same-Sex Marriage Was U.S. Law, They Said ‘I Do’ in Massachusetts
summary: The couples who exchanged vows in May 2004 helped usher in a period of profound change, leading to the U.S. Supreme Court ruling that same-sex marriage is a constitutional right.

title: Reflecting on the Legalization of Same-Sex Marriage a Decade Later
summary: Adam Liptak describes the moment in which same-sex marriage became legal nationwide on June 26, 2015 — and what the future may hold for the Supreme Court’s ruling.

title: Trump’s Bill Slashes the Safety Net That Many Republican Voters Rely on
summary: As they push for big cuts in Medicaid and food stamps, Republicans are making a big bet that they can avoid political backlash from working-class supporters who increasingly rely on those programs.

title: Growth Claims Behind Trump’s Big Policy Bill Rarely Pan Out in Reality
summary: A retrospective on four previous Republican-driven tax-cut packages found that the results always come up short compared to bullish predictions of economic booms and lower deficits.

title: They Escaped War in Ukraine. It Found Them in Israel.
summary: A family of five Ukrainians was killed by an Iranian missile strike in Israel, in a tragic intersection of two wars.

title: Why Ukraine Fell Down the Agenda at the NATO Summit
summary: Russia’s invasion has dominated previous meetings, but keeping President Trump happy was the focus at the gathering this week. Ukraine was largely shunted to the sidelines.

title: In a Win for Trump, NATO Agrees to a Big Increase in Military Spending
summary: President Trump has long pushed the European allies to be more self-sufficient on defense, relying less on American protection. NATO committed to a major increase over the next decade.

title: The Alaska Town at the Center of Trump’s $44 Billion LNG Push
summary: Nikiski in southern Alaska is waiting to see if backing from President Trump and a new developer will advance a decades-old initiative to export natural gas.

title: How Japan and Alaska Pioneered the Global Market for L.N.G.
summary: The leading role the United States plays in liquefied natural gas traces its roots to a small Alaskan outpost that began shipping the fuel to Japan in 1969.

title: Should the Government Stop Subsidizing a Car Feature That ‘Everyone Hates’?
summary: The E.P.A. under Trump is moving to eliminate credits to carmakers for the fuel-saving start-stop function.

title: Summer Gas Prices at 4-Year Low as Israel and Iran Agree to Cease-Fire
summary: A fragile cease-fire in the Middle East and an oil supply chain without significant disruptions have helped keep gas prices stable.

title: How Sandwiches in Canada’s Lloydminster Became a Test for Domestic Trade
summary: A city that straddles two Canadian provinces became a crucible of the barriers that prevent trade across Canada and that Prime Minister Mark Carney wants to dismantle.

title: A C.D.C. Committee Is Debating the Use of Thimerosal in Vaccines. Is It Safe?
summary: A C.D.C. advisory committee will debate the use of thimerosal in flu shots this week.

title: Want a House by Frank Lloyd Wright? There’s a Support Group for That.
summary: A conservancy that aims to preserve the architect’s work also serves as a sort of secret weapon for homeowners who need to troubleshoot maintenance issues.

title: A Photo Gone Wrong in the Uffizi Worries Europe’s Museums
summary: The damage to a centuries-old painting in the Italian museum was just one of many tourist incidents raising ire on the continent.

title: How the Gay Rights Movement Radicalized, and Lost Its Way
summary: In the decade after the Supreme Court decision about same-sex marriage, the lesbian and gay movement has radicalized.

title: Peter Thiel and the Antichrist
summary: A conversation with the original tech right power player.

title: Your Questions About the Economy
summary: You asked. We answered.

title: Late Night Ponders the Possibility of a Millennial Mayor of New York
summary: Jimmy Fallon imagined Zohran Mamdani’s reaction to his surprising success in the primary: “My seven roommates are never going to believe this.”

title: Germany Wants Recruits. But ‘No One Wants Their Children in the Army.’
summary: Given the country’s past, cultural resistance to becoming a soldier is high. Can leaders change minds to meet a changing world?

title: An Investor Took on Hong Kong Tycoons Faces a Tougher Foe
summary: David Webb spent decades exposing shady financial dealings. But doctors say he has months to live, and he hasn’t found anyone willing to carry on his mission.

title: A New Rail Line May Come to New York. Will a Housing Boom Follow?
summary: The Interborough Express, a rail line connecting Brooklyn and Queens, could spur the building of tens of thousands of homes. Obstacles await.
